name: Deterioration of Dwelling
short_description: Condition of dwelling deteriorated due to tenant waste or neglect

deterioration.cause: Acts of waste by tenant or tenant's neglect/default
deterioration.scope: Condition of dwelling or common parts has deteriorated
deterioration.comparison: Worse than normal fair wear and tear

lodger_acts.included: Deterioration caused by lodger or subtenant
lodger_acts.tenant_liability: Tenant liable if they failed to remove lodger after notice

acts_of_waste.definition: Deliberate or negligent acts causing damage
examples: Allowing severe damp through failure to ventilate/heat
Not reporting leaks leading to major damage
Improper disposal of waste causing damage

neglect_examples: Failure to ventilate causing severe mold
Not heating property in winter causing frozen pipes
Not reporting leaks/issues allowing damage to worsen
Allowing garden to become severely overgrown

high_probability: Deterioration beyond fair wear and tear
Tenant's acts or neglect clearly caused damage
medium_probability: Mixture of tenant damage and fair wear
low_probability: Deterioration caused by property defects not tenant

red_flags: Deterioration is normal wear and tear
Damage caused by property defects (e.g., leaking roof)
Landlord failed to repair causing deterioration
No expert report on significant damage
tenant_defenses: Damage is fair wear and tear
Tenant reported issues but landlord ignored
notes: Ground 13 is DISCRETIONARY - focuses on property condition. Requires strong evidence of deterioration beyond fair wear and tear caused by tenant. Often combined with Ground 12 (breach) or 14 (furniture damage). Inventory crucial.
case_law: Holloway v Povey [1984] - Must distinguish waste/neglect from fair wear
Tormes Property Co v Landau [1971] - Evidence of deterioration required
Calabar Properties v Stitcher [1984] - Tenant's fault must be established
court_considerations: Is there clear evidence of deterioration?
Was deterioration caused by tenant's acts or neglect?
Is damage beyond fair wear and tear?

fair_wear_and_tear.definition: Reasonable deterioration from normal use over time
examples: Carpet wearing in high traffic areas
not_fair_wear: Severe mold from lack of ventilation
